Invoke-Expression: Executes a string as code. High risk. Often used to run downloaded payloads.
IEX: Alias for Invoke-Expression. Very common in malware droppers.
New-Object: Creates an instance of a .NET object. Look for 'Net.WebClient'.
Net.WebClient: Used to download content/files from the internet.
DownloadString: Downloads a file into memory as a string. Fileless malware technique.
DownloadFile: Downloads a file from a URL to the disk.
Invoke-WebRequest: Gets content from a web page (curl/wget equivalent).
Hidden: WindowStyle argument to hide the execution from the user.
Bypass: ExecutionPolicy bypass. Allows unauthorized scripts to run.
System.Reflection: Reflective loading. Loads DLLs/assemblies from memory, bypassing disk filters.
[Convert]::FromBase64String: Script decodes another layer of Base64 internally.
